name: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL v. Harry C. JACKSON, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Office of Disciplinary Counsel v. Jackson

judges: Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ.
LARSEN, J., dissents and would disbar respondent.
parties: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL v. Harry C. JACKSON, Appellant.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM:
The Rule to Show Cause why respondent should not be disbarred is discharged and respondent is suspended from the practice of law for five years, effective September 25, 1981.
LARSEN, J., dissents and would disbar respondent.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Stephen P. Shaak, Asst. Discip. Counsel, Harrisburg, for petitioner.
Joseph P. Zawrotny, Philadelphia, for respondent.
casebody.head_matter:
441 A.2d 1193
OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL v. Harry C. JACKSON, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Jan. 19, 1982.
Decided March 8, 1982.
Stephen P. Shaak, Asst. Discip. Counsel, Harrisburg, for petitioner.
Joseph P. Zawrotny, Philadelphia, for respondent.
Before O’BRIEN, C. J., and ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ.
